meanings.definition: A section of a book or magazine that folds out for easier viewing.
meanings.sent1: The foldouts in the magazine displayed a beautiful map of the world.
meanings.sent2: I love it when books have foldouts with detailed illustrations.
meanings.sent3: The foldouts in the book popped out like surprise gifts.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library with foldouts of memories waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The foldouts in the textbook made learning about the solar system so much fun.

meanings.definition: The act of folding out a section of a book or magazine.
meanings.sent1: Carefully opening the foldouts revealed a hidden picture inside.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the foldouts in the book because they added an interactive element.
meanings.sent3: The foldouts seemed to dance as they were unfolded one by one.
meanings.sent4: His ideas unfolded like intricate foldouts, revealing layers of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The foldouts in the magazine made the articles more engaging and informative.
